isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - REAR WINDOW GLASS AND SEAL (AFTER JULY 1993)

svcproc.title: REAR WINDOW GLASS AND SEAL (AFTER JULY 1993)

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 8for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Rear Window Glass and Seal (After July 1993)

calloutgroup.callout1: 7. ARROWS INDICATE DIRECTION OF PULL ON INSTALLATION

warning.para: When removing or installing rear window glass, wear gloves.

step1.para: Using a window weather seal tool (Item 1, Figure 4) (nylon/fiber blade) or a dull screwdriver with rounded edges, from the inside pry weather seal lip from body flange (Item 8) and push glass outward. Start at the bottom edge corner of either side. Push outward in area where seal is being pried off flange.
With an assistant working on the outside of the cab gently pulling on the window, work seal off cab back panel (Item 3) and remove seal and glass (Items 1 and 2) from vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 8for Items in parentheses.

warning.para: When removing or installing rear window glass, wear gloves.

step1.para: Before installing new weather seal (Item 2), clean window area body flange (Item 8) from dirt, wax, sealing compound, etc.

Install weather seal (Item 2) onto rear window glass. Use a water and soap solution to soap the weather seal groove that fits onto the rear window body flange. Also soap the rear window body flange (Item 8).

Use a 1/8 inch nylon rope (Item 5) longer than the circumference of the rear window by approximately one foot or more. Using a piece of steel brake line or copper tubing six inches long with an inside diameter that is small but large enough to feed the 1/8 inch nylon rope through, feed rope through tube.

Starting at either bottom edge corner (Item 6), place the tube with the nylon rope (Item 5) into the flange groove of weather seal (Item 2). Holding rope in place, work tube with rope completely around weather seal groove.

With an assistant, place rear window into position on cab. With the assistant holding the rear window in place from the outside, push the rear window inward at the bottom corner area where installation is being started [at the corner where the rope is (Item 6)].

From the inside of the cab, use a weather seal tool (fiber/nylon blade) or dull screwdriver with rounded edges to work weather seal lip over body flange (Item 8). Once weather seal (Item 2) is started, use the rope (Item 5) to position weather seal lip over body flange.
When pulling on the nylon installation rope (Item 5), pull at a 90 degree angle from the weather seal. Have rope against the glass when pulling.

note.para: Have the assistant push the glass in the opposite direction from which you are pulling the guide rope. Example: If you are pulling down on the rope, the assistant should be pushing up on the rear window in the same area. This action will keep the rear window from moving (Item 7).

svcsubproc.para: After installation of the rear window, clean off excess soap from the glass.
